subject: Communication
title: Forgiveness: The Science of Letting Go
description: Learn Forgiveness: The Science of Letting Go in one minute.

hook.text: Holding a grudge is like drinking poison and expecting the other person to die.

buildup.text: Forgiveness doesn't mean condoning or forgetting. It means releasing the emotional hold the offense has on you.

discovery.text: Stanford research shows forgiveness reduces stress, blood pressure, and depression â€” measurable physical health.

twist.text: Forgiveness isn't primarily for the offender. It's for the person who was harmed. It's a selfish act of self-liberation.

climax.text: Everett Worthington's REACH model provides a structured path: Recall, Empathize, Altruistic gift, Commit, Hold on.

punchline.text: Forgiveness doesn't change the past. It changes your future.

quiz.question: What does forgiveness primarily benefit, according to research?
